MusThGUI.name: MusThGUI
MusThGUI.description:
The Music Theory GUI module allows for display and entry of notes in various
contexts that are suitable for music theory exercises.

The user interface is created by instantiating a {{#crossLink "MusThGUI"}}
{{/crossLink}} object.

Here is an example describing how to use this module:

1) Add an HTMLtag for a small canvas in the web page source, with a unique 'id'
attribute.

	<canvas id="myUniqueID" width="1" height="1"/>

2) Define an XML string that will describe the interface's initial state. Here
is an example that would be well-suited for a scale question:

	var initXML = '<MusThGUI canvasEditable="true" accidentalCarryOver="true">' +
	'<StaffSystem maxLedgerLines="3">' +
	'<Staff clef="treble">' +
	'<KeySign totalAccColumns="7" >' +
	'<Accidental type="#" letter="F" register="5" editable="false" />' +
	'<Accidental type="#" letter="C" register="5" editable="false" />' +
	'<Accidental type="#" letter="G" register="5" editable="false" />' +
	'</KeySign>' +
	'<NoteColumns>' +
	'<NoteColumn maxNotes="1" />' +
	'<NoteColumn maxNotes="1" />' +
	'<NoteColumn maxNotes="1" />' +
	'<NoteColumn maxNotes="1" />' +
	'<NoteColumn maxNotes="1" />' +
	'<NoteColumn maxNotes="1" />' +
	'<NoteColumn maxNotes="1" />' +
	'<NoteColumn maxNotes="1" />' +
	'</NoteColumns>' +
	'</Staff>' +
	'</StaffSystem>' +
	'<Toolbars>' +
	'<AccidentalToolbar>' +
	'<Button symbol="n" />' +
	'<Button symbol="#" />' +
	'<Button symbol="b" />' +
	'<Button symbol="##" />' +
	'<Button symbol="bb" />' +
	'</AccidentalToolbar>' +
	'</Toolbars>' +
	'</MusThGUI>';

For more details on the XML schema that the interface will accept and return,
see the 'valid_input_xml.xsd' file in the module's XML directory.

3) Define a callback function that the interface will use to message back its
current state. This function will be called whenever the user changes the
interface's state (i.e. by adding or deleting notes on the staff).

	var callBack = function(stateXML) {
	//stateXML will contain the most up-to-date canvas state.
	};

4) Create a {{#crossLink "MusThGUI"}}{{/crossLink}} object using the canvas id
from step 1, the XML string from step 2 and the callback function from step 3:

	var musicCanvas = new MusThGUI('myUniqueID', initXML, callBack, true);

Argument 4 specifies whether the interface should be editable after
initialization. Use a false value to display a static interface.

Once instantiated, the MusThGUI object will display an interactive music canvas
on the web page. Whenever the user makes any changes, the callback function will
be called and the most up-to-date canvas state will be returned, as an XML
string.

Control.Controller.name: Control.Controller
Control.Controller.description:
The Controller object instantiates the canvas and handles mouse
events.

params.name: canID
params.description:
The id of the HTMl 5 canvas to which this application
will be bound.

params.name: stateXML
params.description: The canvas state as xml.

params.name: callBackFunc
params.description:
A function that the controller will use
to send the current canvas state back the caller, whenever the state changes.
This function should accept one argument which provides the current state of
the canvas, as an xml string.

Render.CoordManager.name: Render.CoordManager
Render.CoordManager.description:
The CoordManager object provides canvas coordinates for rendering
purposes. It also takes care of converting mouse event coordinates into
canvas elements.

params.name: state
params.description: The canvas state.

GUIState.FiguredBass.name: GUIState.FiguredBass
GUIState.FiguredBass.description:
The FiguredBass object represents a note column's figured bass
notation.

GUIState.FiguredBassRend.name: GUIState.FiguredBassRend
GUIState.FiguredBassRend.description:
The FiguredBassRend object takes care of drawing the figuration
notation on the canvas.

params.name: can
params.description: An html5 canvas element.

params.name: coordMgr
params.description:
The library's coordinate
manager.

params.name: glyphProvider
params.description:
The library's glyph
provider.

params.name: figBass
params.description:
The figured bass to be
rendered.

params.name: staffID
params.description: The zero-based ID of the staff.

params.name: colID
params.description: The zero-based ID of the note column.

params.name: totalAccCols
params.description:
The number of accidental columns
in the key signature portion of the staff.

GUIState.FiguredBassRow.name: GUIState.FiguredBassRow
GUIState.FiguredBassRow.description:
The FiguredBassRow object represents a row in a figured bass
notation (e.g. in the figured notation for a second inversion triad (64),
both 6 and 4 contitute a row of the figured bass).

params.name: rowText
params.description: The text to display in the figured bass row.

Render.GlyphProvider.name: Render.GlyphProvider
Render.GlyphProvider.description:
The GlyphProvider object takes care of loading and returning
image objects to be drawn on the canvas.

params.name: imagesLoadedCallback
params.description:
Function to callback once all images
have been loaded.

Control.InputDialog.name: Control.InputDialog
Control.InputDialog.description:
The InputDialog object represents a javascript dialog used to
enter an answer in one of the canvas' text input. The use of this dialog
allows the use of form elements to format the answer (in particular, the use
of select elements).

params.name: controller
params.description:
The library's controller
object.

params.name: stateXML
params.description:
The canvas state as xml. The xml specifies the
html code to include in the dialog.

GUIState.KeySign.name: GUIState.KeySign
GUIState.KeySign.description: The KeySign object represents a staff's key signature.

params.name: totalAccColumns
params.description:
The total number of accidentals columns
available in the key signature. Providing a total number of columns that is
higher than the number of accidentals initially added to the key signature
allows the user to enter additional accidentals in the key signature.

GUIState.KeySignAcc.name: GUIState.KeySignAcc
GUIState.KeySignAcc.description: The KeySignAcc object represents key signature accidentals.

params.name: type
params.description:
The accidental's type (('n' [natural], '#' [sharp],
'b' [flat], 'x' [double sharp], 'bb' [double flat]).

params.name: letter
params.description: The accidental's letter name.

params.name: register
params.description: The accidental's register.

params.name: editable
params.description:
Indicates whether the accidental can be edited
after initialization.

params.name: isGhost
params.description:
Indicates whether the accidental is to be
displayed as a ghost symbol.

Render.KeySignRend.name: Render.KeySignRend
Render.KeySignRend.description:
The KeySignRend object takes care of drawing a staff's key
signature.

params.name: can
params.description: An html5 canvas element.

params.name: coordMgr
params.description:
The library's coordinate
manager.

params.name: glyphProvider
params.description:
The library's glyph
provider.

params.name: staffID
params.description:
The zero-based ID of the staff where the key
signature is to be rendered.

params.name: clef
params.description: The staff's clef.

params.name: keySign
params.description: The key signature to render.

MusThGUI.name: MusThGUI
MusThGUI.description: The MusThGUI object is used to interact with outside components.

params.name: canID
params.description:
The id of the HTMl 5 canvas to which this application
will be bound.

params.name: stateXML
params.description: The canvas state as xml.

params.name: respCallBack
params.description:
A function that the controller will use
to send the current canvas answer back the caller, whenever the state
changes. This function should accept one argument which provides the
current XML output.

params.name: editable
params.description:
Specifies whether the user can change the UI
after initialization.

GUIState.Note.name: GUIState.Note
GUIState.Note.description: The Note object represents a staff note.

params.name: letter
params.description: The note's letter name.

params.name: register
params.description: The note's register.

params.name: accidental
params.description:
The note's accidental (('n' [natural],
'#' [sharp], 'b' [flat], 'x' [double sharp], 'bb' [double flat]).

params.name: noteValue
params.description:
The note's value ('whole', 'quarter_stem_up',
'quarter_stem_down').

params.name: editable
params.description:
Indicates whether the note can be edited
after initialization.

params.name: isGhost
params.description:
Indicates whether the note is to be
displayed as a ghost symbol.

GUIState.NoteCol.name: GUIState.NoteCol
GUIState.NoteCol.description: The NoteCol object represents a note column on a staff.

params.name: maxNotes
params.description:
The maximum number of notes that the column can
contain.

params.name: textInput
params.description:
The text input associated
with the note column (null if no text input is present).

Render.NoteColRend.name: Render.NoteColRend
Render.NoteColRend.description:
The NoteColRend object takes care of drawing the elements of a
staff's note column.

params.name: can
params.description: An html5 canvas element.

params.name: coordMgr
params.description:
The library's coordinate
manager.

params.name: glyphProvider
params.description:
The library's glyph
provider.

params.name: staff
params.description:
The staff containing this note
column.

params.name: staffID
params.description:
The zero-based ID of the staff where containing the
note column.

params.name: noteColID
params.description: The zero-based ID of this note column.

params.name: accCarryOver
params.description:
Indicates whether accidentals are to carry
over

Render.NoteRend.name: Render.NoteRend
Render.NoteRend.description: The NoteRend object takes care of drawing a note on a staff.

params.name: can
params.description: An html5 canvas element.

params.name: coordMgr
params.description:
The library's coordinate
manager.

params.name: glyphProvider
params.description:
The library's glyph
provider.

params.name: note
params.description: The note to be rendered.

params.name: noteColID
params.description:
The zero-based ID of this note column containing
the note.

params.name: staffID
params.description:
The zero-based ID of the staff where the note is to
be rendered.

params.name: clef
params.description: The staff's clef.

params.name: keySignTotalAccColumns
params.description:
The total number of accidentals
columns in the key signature.

params.name: displayAcc
params.description:
Indicates whether the note's accidental should
be displayed.

params.name: accPos
params.description:
A number indicating whether and how much an
accidental should be offset to the left of the note (e.g. 0 = no offset, 1 =
one offset level to the left, 2 = two offset levels to teh left, etc.).

params.name: displayAccPar
params.description:
Indicates whether the note's accidental should
be parenthesized.

Render.Renderer.name: Render.Renderer
Render.Renderer.description: The Renderer object takes care of drawing all canvas elements.

params.name: can
params.description: An html5 canvas element.

params.name: state
params.description: The canvas' state.

params.name: coordMgr
params.description:
The library's coordinate
manager.

params.name: glyphProvider
params.description:
The library's glyph
provider.

GUIState.Staff.name: GUIState.Staff
GUIState.Staff.description: The Staff object represents a staff.

params.name: clef
params.description: The staff's clef.

params.name: keySign
params.description: The staff's key signature.

Render.StaffRend.name: Render.StaffRend
Render.StaffRend.description: The StaffRend object takes care of drawing a staff.

params.name: can
params.description: An html5 canvas element.

params.name: coordMgr
params.description:
The library's coordinate
manager.

params.name: glyphProvider
params.description:
The library's glyph
provider.

params.name: staff
params.description: The staff to be rendered.

params.name: staffID
params.description: The zero-based ID of the staff to be rendered.

params.name: accCarryOver
params.description:
Indicates whether accidentals are to carry
over

GUIState.StaffSystem.name: GUIState.StaffSystem
GUIState.StaffSystem.description: The StaffSystem object stores the canvas state's staff system.

Render.StaffSystemRend.name: Render.StaffSystemRend
Render.StaffSystemRend.description: The StaffSystemRend object takes care of drawing a staff system.

params.name: can
params.description: An html5 canvas element.

params.name: coordMgr
params.description:
The library's coordinate
manager.

params.name: glyphProvider
params.description:
The library's glyph
provider.

params.name: staffSystem
params.description:
The staff system to be
rendered.

params.name: accCarryOver
params.description:
Indicates whether accidentals are to carry
over

GUIState.State.name: GUIState.State
GUIState.State.description:
The State object stores the canvas context
(e.g. number of staves, clefs, key signature, notes, toolbars, input dialog,
etc).

GUIState.TextInput.name: GUIState.TextInput
GUIState.TextInput.description: The TextInput object represents a staff.

params.name: value
params.description: The text input's value.

params.name: editable
params.description:
Indicates whether the text input's value can be
changed after initialization.

GUIState.Toolbar.name: GUIState.Toolbar
GUIState.Toolbar.description: The Toolbar object represents canvas toolbars.

params.name: name
params.description:
The name of the toolbar ('acc' for an accidental
toolbar, 'noteVal' for a note value  toolbar).

GUIState.ToolbarBtn.name: GUIState.ToolbarBtn
GUIState.ToolbarBtn.description: Represents the state of a toolbar button.

params.name: symbol
params.description:
A string indicating the type of musical symbol to
display in a toolbar button ('n' [natural], '#' [sharp], 'b' [flat],
'x' [double sharp], 'bb' [double flat], 'whole' [whole note],
'quarter_stem_up' [quarter note with stem up],
'quarter_stem_down' [quarter note with stem down]).

Render.ToolbarBtnRend.name: Render.ToolbarBtnRend
Render.ToolbarBtnRend.description: The ToolbarBtnRend object takes care of drawing a toolbar button.

params.name: can
params.description: An html5 canvas element.

params.name: glyphProvider
params.description:
The library's glyph
provider.

params.name: button
params.description:
The toolbar button to be
rendered.

params.name: x
params.description: The x-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the button.

params.name: y
params.description: The y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the button.

params.name: width
params.description: The button's width.

params.name: height
params.description: The button's height.

Render.ToolbarRend.name: Render.ToolbarRend
Render.ToolbarRend.description: The ToolbarRend object takes care of drawing a toolbar.

params.name: can
params.description: An html5 canvas element.

params.name: coordMgr
params.description:
The library's coordinate
manager.

params.name: glyphProvider
params.description:
The library's glyph
provider.

params.name: toolbar
params.description: The toolbar to be rendered.

GUIState.TwoVoiceNoteCol.name: GUIState.TwoVoiceNoteCol
GUIState.TwoVoiceNoteCol.description:
The TwoVoiceNoteCol object represents a note column on a staff,
specifically designed to handle a voice-leading context where two voices are
shown in the column, with stems in opposite direction.

params.name: figBass
params.description:
The note column's figured
bass indication.

params.name: textInput
params.description:
The text input associated
with the note column (null if no text input is present).

classitems.description:
Callback function indicating that canvas images have been loaded. Finishes
canvases initialization.
classitems.name: onImagesLoaded

classitems.description:
Translates the window-based point location of a mouse event into a
canvas-based location.
classitems.name: getLocalCoord

params.name: e
params.description: The mouse event.

return.description:
An object literal with properties x and y, representing
the canvas based location.

classitems.description: Binds listener functions to mouse events.
classitems.name: bindEventListeners

classitems.description: Handles a canvas mouse click event.
classitems.name: onMouseClick

params.name: point
params.description:
An object literal representing the location of the
mouse click, with properties x and y.

classitems.description: Handles a canvas mouse move event.
classitems.name: onMouseMove

params.name: point
params.description:
An object literal representing the location of the
mouseover event, with properties x and y.

classitems.description:
Given a mouse event location, determine if a canvas element (note,
key signature accidental, toolbar button, text input) was involved, and if
so, return the element.
classitems.name: getElementFromPoint

params.name: point
params.description:
An object literal representing the location of the
mouse event, with properties x and y.

return.description:
An object literal with a property 'elemType' indicating the
type of element that was involved (if null, no element was involved).
Additional properties, customized for a given type, provide additional
details on the element.

classitems.description: Deletes the current ghost note (if displayed) from the canvas state.
classitems.name: removeGhostNote

classitems.description: Deletes the current ghost accidental (if displayed) from the canvas state.
classitems.name: removeGhostAcc

classitems.description: Disables the overlay effect for all toolbar buttons for which it is enabled.
classitems.name: clearToolbarOverlays

classitems.description: Draws the canvas state.
classitems.name: drawState

classitems.description:
Given a column ID and a text input value, sets the value of the column's text
input to the given value.
classitems.name: setColTextInput

params.name: colID
params.description: The zero-based ID of the column.

params.name: value
params.description: The value to be assigned to the text input.

classitems.description: Determines the width of the canvas.
classitems.name: getCanvasWidth

params.name: numNoteCols
params.description:
The number of note columns in one of the
canvas' staves (with the assumption that each staff will have the same number
of note columns).

params.name: totalAccColumns
params.description:
The number of accidental columns
in the key signature portion of one of the canvas' staves (with the
assumption that each staff will have the same number of key signature
accidental columns).

params.name: numToolbars
params.description: The number of canvas toolbars.

return.description: The width of the canvas.

classitems.description: Determines the height of the canvas.
classitems.name: getCanvasHeight

params.name: numStaves
params.description: The number of staves in the staff system.

params.name: maxNumToolbarBtns
params.description:
The number of buttons for the longest
toolbar in the state.

params.name: hasTextInput
params.description:
Indicating whether at least one column in the
staff system has a text input.

return.description: The height of the canvas.

classitems.description:
Determine an appropriate note column width for the staff system, given the
maximum number of notes in the columns.
classitems.name: getColWidth

params.name: maxNotes
params.description:
The maximum number of notes in the staff system's
note columns, with the assumption that all note columns in the staff system
will have the same maximum number of notes).

return.description: The note column width.

classitems.description:
Builds an array listing all white notes on the piano keyboard. All notes are
assigned an integer ID. This array can be used to determine the stepwise
distance between two notes on the staff.
classitems.name: noteArrayBuild

return.description:
The keyboard note array, which can be referenced by ID
(i.e. array.A0 returns 0) or by note name (i.e. array[0] returns 'A0').

classitems.description:
For each note in the coordinate manager's note array (this.notes), determines
the number of ledger lines required to draw the note and whether the ledger
lines are to be drawn above or below the note head.
classitems.name: setLedgerLines

return.description:
An array of object literals with two properties:
numLines, which provides the number of lines, and loc, which is set to
'above' or 'below'. Each literal is accessed using the clef and the note
name, separated by a hyphen (e.g. array.treble-G3 returns {numlines: 2,
loc: 'above'}).

classitems.description: Computes the width of a staff.
classitems.name: getStaffWidth

params.name: numNoteCols
params.description: The number of note columns in the staff.

params.name: totalAccColumns
params.description:
The number of accidental columns
in the key signature portion of the staff.

return.description: The width of the staff.

classitems.description: Computes the height of a staff.
classitems.name: getStaffHeight

params.name: withLedgerLines
params.description:
Indicates whether the ledger line portion
of the staff should be included in the computation.

return.description: The height of the staff.

classitems.description: Computes the height of the staff system.
classitems.name: getStaffSystemHeight

params.name: numStaves
params.description: The number of staves in the staff system.

return.description: The height of the staff system.

classitems.description: Provides the location of the upper left corner of the staff system.
classitems.name: getStaffSystemOrigin

return.description:
An object literal of the form {x:__, y:__} representing
the staff system's origin.

classitems.description: Provides the location of the upper left corner a staff.
classitems.name: getStaffOrigin

params.name: staffID
params.description: The zero-based ID of the staff.

return.description:
An object literal of the form {x:__, y:__} representing
the staff's origin.

classitems.description: Provides the location of the upper left corner a staff line.
classitems.name: getStaffLinePos

params.name: staffID
params.description: The zero-based ID of the staff.

params.name: lineID
params.description: The zero-based ID of the staff line.

return.description:
An object literal of the form {x:__, y:__} representing
the staff line's origin.

classitems.description: Provides the location of the clef in a given staff.
classitems.name: getClefPos

params.name: staffID
params.description: The zero-based ID of the staff.

return.description:
An object literal of the form {x:__, y:__} representing
the clef's location.

classitems.description: Provides the location of a key signature accidental.
classitems.name: getKeySignAccPos

params.name: staffID
params.description: The zero-based ID of the staff.

params.name: clef
params.description: The staff's clef.

params.name: keySignColID
params.description:
The zero-based ID of the key signature column
where the accidental lies.

params.name: letter
params.description: The accidental's letter name.

params.name: register
params.description: The accidental's register.

return.description:
An object literal of the form {x:__, y:__} representing
the key signature accidental's location.

classitems.description:
Provides the x-coordinate of the center of a given key signature accidental
column.
classitems.name: getKeySignColCenterX

params.name: staffID
params.description: The zero-based ID of the staff.

params.name: keySignColID
params.description: The key signature column.

classitems.description: Provides the y-coordinate of a given staff's highest possible note.
classitems.name: getTopNoteY

params.name: staffID
params.description: The zero-based ID of the staff.

classitems.description: Provides the y of a given note on a staff.
classitems.name: getLetterNameY

params.name: staffID
params.description: The zero-based ID of the staff.

params.name: clef
params.description: The staff's clef.

params.name: letter
params.description: The note's letter.

params.name: register
params.description: The note's register.

classitems.description: Provides the stepwise distance between two notes on the staff.
classitems.name: getStepwiseNoteDist

params.name: note1
params.description:
The first note's name as letter + register
(e.g. 'A4').

params.name: note2
params.description:
The second note's name as letter + register
(e.g. 'A4').

return.description: The number of steps on the staff between the two notes.

classitems.description: Provides the x-coordinate of the center of a given note column.
classitems.name: getNoteColCenterX

params.name: staffID
params.description: The zero-based ID of the staff.

params.name: noteColID
params.description: The zero-based ID of the note column.

params.name: totalAccColumns
params.description:
The number of accidental columns
in the key signature portion of the staff.

classitems.description: Provides the location of a given note on a staff.
classitems.name: getNotePos

params.name: letter
params.description: The note's letter.

params.name: register
params.description: The note's register.

params.name: staffID
params.description: The zero-based ID of the staff.

params.name: clef
params.description: The staff's clef.

params.name: noteColID
params.description: The zero-based ID of the note column.

params.name: totalAccColumns
params.description:
The number of accidental columns
in the key signature portion of the staff.

classitems.description: Provides the y-coordinate of a given note's ledger lines.
classitems.name: getLedgerLinesY

params.name: staffID
params.description: The zero-based ID of the staff.

params.name: clef
params.description: The staff's clef.

params.name: letter
params.description: The note's letter.

params.name: register
params.description: The note's register.

return.description:
An array providing the y-coordinate for each line. If the
given note is above the staff, the ledger lines are provided in descending
order, otherwise they are provided in ascending order.

classitems.description: Provides the interval size between two notes on the staff.
classitems.name: getIntervalSize

params.name: note1
params.description:
The first note's name as letter + register
(e.g. 'A4').

params.name: note2
params.description:
The second note's name as letter + register
(e.g. 'A4').

return.description: The interval size between the two notes.

classitems.description:
Given a canvas point, determine if a canvas element (note, key signature
accidental, toolbar button, text input) is located at this point, and if
so, return the element.
classitems.name: getElementByPos

params.name: point
params.description:
An object literal representing the point, with
properties x and y.

params.name: staves
params.description: The number of staves in the staff system.

params.name: numCols
params.description:
The number of note columns in one of the
canvas' staves (with the assumption that each staff will have the same number
of note columns).

params.name: totalAccColumns
params.description:
The number of accidental columns
in the key signature portion of one of the canvas' staves (with the
assumption that each staff will have the same number of key signature
accidental columns).

params.name: toolbars
params.description:
An array of the canvas'
toolbars.

params.name: hasTextInput
params.description:
Indicates whether at least one column in the
staff system has a text input.

return.description:
An object literal with a property 'elemType' indicating the
type of element that was involved (if null, no element was involved).
Additional properties, customized for a given type, provide additional
details on the element.

classitems.description:
Given a canvas point, determine if a text input element is located at this
point, and if so, return the text input.
classitems.name: pointToTextInput

params.name: point
params.description:
An object literal representing the point, with
properties x and y.

params.name: numCols
params.description:
The number of note columns in one of the
canvas' staves (with the assumption that each staff will have the same number
of note columns).

params.name: totalAccColumns
params.description:
The number of accidental columns
in the key signature portion of one of the canvas' staves (with the
assumption that each staff will have the same number of key signature
accidental columns).

return.description:
If a text input is found, returns an object literal of the
form {elemType: 'textInput', colID: __} representing the text input.
Otherwise, returns an object literal of the form {elemType: null}.

classitems.description:
Given a canvas point and a staff, determine if a note is located at this
point, and if so, return the note.
classitems.name: pointToStaffNote

params.name: point
params.description:
An object literal representing the point, with
properties x and y.

params.name: staffID
params.description: The zero-based ID of the staff.

params.name: clef
params.description: The staff's clef.

params.name: numCols
params.description:
The number of note columns in one of the
canvas' staves (with the assumption that each staff will have the same number
of note columns).

params.name: totalAccColumns
params.description:
The number of accidental columns
in the key signature portion of one of the canvas' staves (with the
assumption that each staff will have the same number of key signature
accidental columns).

return.description:
If a note is found, an object literal of the form
{elemType: 'note', staffID: __, colID: __, noteName: __} representing
the note. Otherwise, returns an object literal of the form {elemType: null}.

classitems.description:
Given a canvas point and a staff, determine if a key signature accidental is
located at this point, and if so, return the key signature accidental.
classitems.name: pointToKeySignAcc

params.name: point
params.description:
An object literal representing the point, with
properties x and y.

params.name: staffID
params.description: The zero-based ID of the staff.

params.name: clef
params.description: The staff's clef.

params.name: totalAccCols
params.description:
The number of accidental columns
in the key signature portion of one of the canvas' staves (with the
assumption that each staff will have the same number of key signature
accidental columns).

return.description:
If a key signature accidental is found, return an object
literal of the form {elemType: 'keySign', staffID: __, colID: __,
noteName: __} representing the key signature accidental. Otherwise, returns
an object literal of the form {elemType: null}.

classitems.description:
Given a canvas point and a toolbar, determine if a toolbar button is located
at this point, and if so, return the toolbar button.
classitems.name: pointToToolbarBtn

params.name: point
params.description:
An object literal representing the point, with
properties x and y.

params.name: toolbarID
params.description: The zero-based ID of the toolbar.

params.name: toolbarName
params.description: The name of the toolbar.

params.name: numToolbarBtns
params.description: The number of buttons in the toolbar.

return.description:
If a toolbar button is found, return an object
literal of the form {elemType: 'toolbar', toolbarName: __, buttonID: __}
representing the toolbar button. Otherwise, returns an object literal of the
form {elemType: null}.

classitems.description:
Given a y coordinate and a staff, returns the note name associated with the
y coordinate.
classitems.name: getNoteFromY

params.name: staffID
params.description: The zero-based ID of the staff.

params.name: clef
params.description: The staff's clef.

params.name: noteY
params.description: The y coordinate.

return.description: The note name as letter + register (e.g. 'A4').

classitems.description:
Given a point and a rectangle's upper left and lower right corners, determine
if the point lies within the rectangle.
classitems.name: pointWithin

params.name: point
params.description:
An object literal representing the point, with
properties x and y.

params.name: llPoint
params.description:
An object literal representing the rectangle's upper
left corner, with properties x and y.

params.name: brPoint
params.description:
An object literal representing the rectangle's lower
right corner, with properties x and y.

return.description: Returns true if the point lies within the rectangle.

classitems.description:
Povides the size of toolbar buttons. It is assumed that all toolbar buttons
are square.
classitems.name: getToolbarBtnSize

classitems.description: Povides the x-coordinate of the upper left corner of a given toolbar.
classitems.name: getToolbarX

params.name: toolbarID
params.description: The zero-based ID of the toolbar.

classitems.description: Povides the y-coordinate of the upper left corner of a given toolbar.
classitems.name: getToolbarY

params.name: numToolbarBtns
params.description:
The number of toolbar buttons in the
toolbar.

classitems.description: Add a figured bass row to the  figured bass notation.
classitems.name: addRow

params.name: row
params.description:
The figured bass row to be
added.

classitems.description: Draws the figured bass on the canvas.
classitems.name: draw

classitems.description:
Callback function called whenever an image has finished loading. Once
all images have loaded, call the controller's callback function so that
canvas initialization can complete.
classitems.name: imgLoaded

classitems.description: Returns the specified accidental image.
classitems.name: getAccidental

params.name: accType
params.description:
The type of accidental image to return ('n', '#',
'b', 'x', 'bb').

params.name: inColor
params.description:
If true, returns a color version of the
accidental.

params.name: figuredBass
params.description:
If true, returns a version to display within the
figured bass (only available for sharps, flat and naturals).

params.name: parenthesized
params.description:
If true, returns a parenthesized version of
the accidental

return.description: Returns the accidental image.

classitems.description: Returns the specified accidental image.
classitems.name: getNoteValue

params.name: noteValueType
params.description:
The type of accidental image to return
('whole', 'quarter_stem_up', 'quarter_stem_down').

params.name: inColor
params.description:
If true, returns a color version of the
accidental.

params.name: forToolbar
params.description:
If true, returns a smaller version for toolbar
display (only available for quarter notes).

return.description: Returns the note value image.

classitems.description: Returns the specified clef image.
classitems.name: getClef

params.name: clefType
params.description:
The type of clef ('treble', 'bass', 'alto',
'tenor').

return.description: Returns the clef image.

classitems.description: Initializes the input dialog.
classitems.name: init

classitems.description: Displays the input dialog.
classitems.name: show

classitems.description: Resets all form elements to empty values.
classitems.name: resetDialogForm

classitems.description: Resets all form elements to empty values.
classitems.name: callBack

params.name: combinedInput
params.description:
The form's input, to be sent back to the
controller object passed as argument to the constructor.

classitems.description: Adds an accidental to the key signature.
classitems.name: addAccidental

params.name: accidental
params.description:
The key signature
accidental to be added.

classitems.description: Removes the accidental from the specified accidental column.
classitems.name: removeAccidental

params.name: accColID
params.description:
The zero-based ID of the accidental column from
which the accidental will be removed.

classitems.description:
Given a letter name, register and accidental column ID, indicates whether an
editable accidental is present at that locationin the key signature.
classitems.name: containsEditableAccidental

params.name: ltr
params.description: The accidental's letter name.

params.name: reg
params.description: The accidental's register.

params.name: colID
params.description:
The zero-based ID of the accidental column where the
editable is to be found.

return.description:
Returns true if an editable accidental is found at the
specified location.

classitems.description:
Indicates whether an accidental has been assigned to all accidental columns
in the key signature.
classitems.name: isFull

return.description:
Returns true if all accidental columns in the key
signature have an accidental.

classitems.description: Indicates whether an accidental is present in a given accidental column.
classitems.name: columnIsFull

params.name: colID
params.description: The zero-based ID of the accidental column.

return.description: Returns true an accidental is found in the given column.

classitems.description: Draws the key signature on the staff.
classitems.name: draw

classitems.description: Compares two notes with respect to letter and register (accidentals ignored).
classitems.name: compare

params.name: note1
params.description: The first note to be compared.

params.name: note2
params.description: The second note to be compared.

return.description:
Returns 1 is note1 > note 2, 0 if note1 = note 2, and
-1 and note1 < note2.

classitems.description: Adds a note to the note column.
classitems.name: addNote

params.name: note
params.description: The note to be added.

classitems.description:
Removes a note from the note column. No action taken if the given note isn't
in the column.
classitems.name: removeNote

params.name: note
params.description: The note to be removed.

classitems.description:
Removes the ghost note from the column, if present. It is assumed that there
can be at most one ghost note in the column at any given time.
classitems.name: removeGhostNote

classitems.description:
Indicates whether the given note is present in the column (ghost notes
ignored).
classitems.name: inColumn

params.name: note
params.description: The note to look for.

return.description:
Returns the found note. If the note
isn't found, returns null.

classitems.description:
Indicates whether the number of non-ghost notes in the column is equal to
the maximum number of notes allowable in the column.
classitems.name: isFull

return.description: Returns true if the note column is full.

classitems.description: Indicates whether the given note can be added to the column.
classitems.name: noteAddible

params.name: potentialNote
params.description: The note to consider adding.

return.description: Returns true if the note can be added to the column.

classitems.description: Indicates whether the given note can be removed from the column.
classitems.name: noteRemovable

params.name: note
params.description: The note to consider removing.

return.description: Returns true if the note can be removed from the column.

classitems.description: Draws the note column's elements  on the staff.
classitems.name: draw

classitems.description:
Indicates whether a given note's accidental should be displayed. Accidentals
are assumed to carry over from one note column to the next.
classitems.name: displayAccidental

params.name: note
params.description:
The note whose accidental display is
to be considered.

params.name: prevColNote
params.description:
The previous note in the note
column, if present (null is assumed otherwise).

params.name: nextColNote
params.description:
The next note in the note
column, if present (null is assumed otherwise).

return.description: Returns true if the note can be removed from the column.

classitems.description: Draws the note on the staff.
classitems.name: draw

params.name: noteOffset
params.description:
Indicates whether the note should be offset to
the right so that its note head doesn't overlap with a note displayed a step
below.

classitems.description: Draws all canvas elements.
classitems.name: draw

classitems.description: Adds a note column to the staff.
classitems.name: addNoteColumn

params.name: noteCol
params.description: The note column to be added.

classitems.description: Draws the staff.
classitems.name: draw

classitems.description: Draws staff lines.
classitems.name: drawLines

classitems.description: Draws the staff's clef.
classitems.name: drawClef

classitems.description: Draws the staff's key signature.
classitems.name: drawKeySign

classitems.description: Draws the staff's note columns.
classitems.name: drawNoteColumns

classitems.description: Adds a staff to the canvas state's staff system.
classitems.name: addStaff

params.name: staff
params.description: The staff to be added.

classitems.description: Indicates whether at least one column in the staff system has a text input.
classitems.name: hasTextInput

classitems.description: Draws the staff system.
classitems.name: draw

classitems.description: Sets the state after instantiation.
classitems.name: setState

params.name: stateXML
params.description:
The canvas state as xml, used to build the state
object.

classitems.description: Returns the canvas state.
classitems.name: getState

return.description: The canvas state as xml.

classitems.description: Indicates whether the state contains a toolbar, given the toolbar name.
classitems.name: hasToolbar

params.name: name
params.description: The toolbar name.

return.description: {Boolean)

classitems.description: Returns a toolbar, given the toolbar name.
classitems.name: getToolbar

params.name: name
params.description: The toolbar name.

return.description:
Returns null if the toolbar
isn't found.

classitems.description: Returns the number of buttons for the longest toolbar in the state.
classitems.name: getMaxNumToolbarButtons

return.description: Returns 0 if the state doesn't have any toolbars.

classitems.description: Adds a button to the toolbar.
classitems.name: addButton

params.name: btn
params.description: The button to be added.

classitems.description:
Set a toolbar button as selected. Only one button may be selected at
any one time.
classitems.name: select

params.name: btnID
params.description: The zero-based position of the button to be selected.

classitems.description: Enables the mouseOverlay property of a button in the toolbar.
classitems.name: setMouseOverlay

params.name: btnID
params.description:
The zero-based position of the button to be displayed
with an overlay. If this argument is null, the mouseOverlay property is
disabled for all buttons in the toolbar.

classitems.description: Returns the symbol of the button currently selected in the toolbar.
classitems.name: selectedSymbol

classitems.description:
Returns the zero-based position of the button currently selected in the
toolbar.
classitems.name: selectedID

classitems.description: Draws the toolbar button.
classitems.name: draw

classitems.description: Draws the toolbar.
classitems.name: draw

params.name: toolbarID
params.description: The zero-based ID of the toolbar to be rendered.

classitems.description:
Adds a note to the note column. Once the note is added, rearranges note stems
so that they are in the opposite direction.
classitems.name: addNote

params.name: note
params.description: The note to be added.

classitems.description:
Removes a note from the note column. No action taken if the given note isn't
in the column. If two notes are in unison in the column, both notes are
removed. Once the note is removed, rearranges note stems so that they are in
the opposite direction.
classitems.name: removeNote

params.name: note
params.description: The note to be removed.

classitems.description:
Removes the ghost note from the column, if present. It is assumed that there
can be at most one ghost note in the column at any given time. Once the ghost
note is removed, rearranges note stems so that they are in the opposite
direction.
classitems.name: removeGhostNote

classitems.description: Rearranges the note stems, as needed, so that they are in opposite direction.
classitems.name: rearrangeStems

classitems.description: Indicates whether the given note can be added to the column.
classitems.name: noteAddible

params.name: potentialNote
params.description: The note to consider adding.

return.description: Returns true if the note can be added to the column.

classitems.description: Indicates whether the given note can be removed from the column.
classitems.name: noteRemovable

params.name: note
params.description: The note to consider removing.

return.description: Returns true if the note can be removed from the column.

classitems.description:
Provides the number of notes currently in the column, excluding the ghost
note.
classitems.name: lengthWithoutGhost

return.description: Returns the number of non-ghost notes in the column.

classitems.description: Provides the first non-ghost note in the column.
classitems.name: getFirstNonGhost

return.description:
Returns the first non-ghost note in
the column. If the column doesn't have non-ghost notes, returns null.
